intro: Oenothera scitula, commonly known as the plains evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its yellow flowers that open in the evening, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairie and steppe habitats. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is an important plant for pollinators such as moths and beetles. Oenothera scitula is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
